head.title: Treasury Auctions Scheduled for This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Auctions Scheduled for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 4.78 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 4.97 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.79 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financing this week includes today's regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills tomorrow.

At the close of the New York cash market on Friday, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 4.78 percent. The rate on the six-month issue was 4.97 percent, and the rate on the four-week issue was 4.79 percent.
The following tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAX-EXEMPT
TOMORROW
Prince George's County, Md., $245.2 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
WEDNESDAY
Las Vegas Valley Water District, Nev., $82.5 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
New Jersey Educational Facilities Authority, $325 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
San Jose, Calif., $93.5 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
State of Virginia, $146.7 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
State of Wisconsin, $150 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
THURSDAY
New Jersey Environment Infrastructure, $114.2 million of debt securities. Competitive.
TAX-EXEMPT ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Albemarle, N.C., Hospital Authority, $68 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
Baltimore Water and Wastewater Projects, $151 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
California Educational Facilities Authority, $188 million of debt securities for Stanford University. Morgan Stanley.
City of Phoenix, $188.8 million of senior revenue and taxable bonds for civic improvement. RBC Capital Markets.
Clarke County, Ga., School District, $50 million of general obligation bonds. A. G. Edwards & Sons.
California Department of Veterans Affairs, $207 million of home purchase revenue bonds. Merrill Lynch.
Fillmore, Calif., Wastewater Treatment, $73 million of debt securities. Bear Stearns.
Fort Bend County, Tex., $130 million of limited tax bonds. Siebert Brandford Shank.
Massachusetts Health and Education Facilities Authority, $300 million of revenue bonds for Partners HealthCare System. JPMorgan Securities.
Massachusetts Housing, $50 million of single-family mortgage revenue bonds. UBS Securities.
Modesto, Calif., Irrigation District Finance Authority, $90 million of debt securities. Bear Stearns.
New Mexico Mortgage Finance Authority, $50 million of debt securities. George K. Baum.
New York City Transitional Finance Authority, $370 million of future tax secured subordinate bonds. Ramirez & Company.
New York State Thruway Authority, $354 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch.
Orlando-Orange County, Fla., Expressway, $425 million of debt securities. Citigroup Global Markets.
State of Illinois, $270 million of general obligation bonds. Loop Capital Markets.
State of Illinois, $150 million of general obligation bonds. Popular Securities.
Texas Transportation Commission, $1.6 billion of general obligation mobility funds. Morgan Stanley.
